title: Can we get a list of approved apps?
body:
With this latest wave of bans for 3rd party apps, I feel like there are a lot of people who feel like they were unjustly banned for "third party programs".  I think we can alleviate some of these bans, if we keep a running list of what programs are appropriate to use.  If the app that you want to use is not on the list, then you use that at your own risk.

It seems pretty obvious, to me at least, that Skype or Teamspeak would be fine to use since they offer no inherent advantage to players other than voice communication.  It would give some gamers the peace of mind in knowing that the programs that they are using are fine to use by Riot.

replies.body: These most recent suspensions are for scripting suites, specifically.  Custom assets, skin installers, or voice applications just tend to be an easier scapegoat for those attempting to dispute a ban, but to be clear, we're not going to action for any modification that doesn't directly influence competitive integrity.

TL;DR - No.

The problem and confusion that I see is, that the legality (I can't think of a better word at the moment) of some 3rd party programs are and are not acceptable.  For example, when Curse Voice was first introduced, it was in blatant violation of the ToU.  However Riot changed their stance and then allowed Curse Voice and Razer Comms in this post [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/riot-official/EbE4QMZW-an-update-on-3rd-party-mods-and-curse-voice?show=flat&comment=000f).

And technically speaking, Skype would be considered a 3rd party program.  Yet I highly doubt that Riot would ever ban anyone for using Skype.  But I think that most of us would agree that using a voice chat of some sort (Teamspeak, discord, Skype etc.) would not be in violation of the ToU.  But it would be nice to get a firm stance on it.

I guess I'm also hesitant to install a replay system on my computer because, quite frankly, I don't want to get banned.  I've seen pros use Overwolf for the instant replay analysis to see what happened in the last team fight since it only records the last 20 seconds.  I think something like that would be helpful to me, since I'm just terrible at this game, so I can see what I did wrong.  Yet I'm afraid to install it on my computer because I don't want to get banned for it.  With my Nvidia Graphics card, I have shadow play, is it alright for me to use that?

The other problem is, these programs have patches and changes every so often.  I would hate to get punished if my Curse Voice changed in a patch that violates the ToU and I get punished for that.

Skype just can't interact with league in any way so it can't be detected by Riot, unless THEY are doing some illegal scans on our PCs.

You won't get banned for using Overwolf's utilities because they're literally created and distributed by Cloud 9. I'm fairly certain Riot has also said themselves that they're ok with it at some point.

So, we will never get an **official** list of approved apps, it has been said and explained a lot of time already.

But could the community maintain an officious list of apps approved-to-the-best-of-our-knowledge, with the date and version "approved"? And could this thread be stickied?
